title: Visuo-Kinesthetic-Based Anatomy Education Design: Practice-Centered Learning for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic anatomical terminology and human anatomy
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-based limited-technology environments, emphasizing tactile learning through actual bone model utilization

learning_goals: Learners can visually and kinesthetically analyze 3D human anatomy (joints, bones) and explain key names and functions with 80% accuracy
By comparing smartphone apps with physical bone models, learners can achieve over 70 points (out of 100) on anatomy assessment items utilizing spatial cognition skills
Learners can propose two customized anatomy teaching strategies to support peer teachers with low spatial ability

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
